markup.content: Hi, I’m Beth. I’m here to guide you through the COVID-19 Interactive Center.
To provide you with the most accurate information, we are going to ask you a series of questions.
During our chat, you can close the chat window if you need to start again.
Ready? Let’s get started.
How can I help you today?
Welcome to the COVID-19 Self-Cheker.
If you are experiencing a life-threatening emergency, please call 911 immediately.
This system does not replace the judgment of healthcare professionals or the performance of any clinical assessment.
To provide information on the right level of care, we are going to ask you a series of questions.
During the assessment, you can refresh the page if you need to start again or close the chat window.
Ready? Let’s get started.
Where are you located?
COVID-19 Self-Cheker is intended for people currently located in the City of Detroit
Please check the Center for Disease Control and Prevention for more information about COVID-19 in your location.
Visit CDC Website
Are you ill, or caring for someone who is ill?
Sounds like you or the person you are caring are feeling ok.
Please visit the City of Detroit Coronavirus website for more the most recent updates.
Visit City of Detroit Website
What is your (their) age? Please enter the number of years.
If you are filling this for a person under 1 year old. Just enter 0.
Are they experiencing any of the following lifethreatening symptoms?

items.name: no-waking
items.description: Not waking up or not interacting when awake
items.text: Not waking up or not interacting when awake

items.name: irritable
items.description: So irritable that the child does not want to be held
items.text: So irritable that the child does not want to be held

markup.content: Call 911 – You may be having a medical emergency.
Sorry, this Coronavirus SelfChecker is for people who are at least 2 years old.
What is your (their) gender?
Are you (they) experiencing any of the following lifethreatening symptoms?

items.name: breath
items.description: Gasping for air or cannot talk without catching your breath (extremely difficult breathing)
items.text: Gasping for air or cannot talk without catching your breath (extremely difficult breathing)

items.name: pain
items.description: Severe and constant pain or pressure in the chest
items.text: Severe and constant pain or pressure in the chest

items.name: dizziness
items.description: Severe and constant dizziness or lightheadedness
items.text: Severe and constant dizziness or lightheadedness

items.name: unconscious
items.description: Unconscious or very difficult to wake up
items.text: Unconscious or very difficult to wake up

items.name: seizures
items.description: New seizure or seizures that won’t stop
items.text: New seizure or seizures that won’t stop

markup.content: Do you (they) have any of the following?

items.name: breathing
items.description: Moderate to severe difficulty breathing (unable to speak full sentences)
items.text: Moderate to severe difficulty breathing (unable to speak full sentences)

items.name: cough
items.description: Coughing up blood (more than about 1 teaspoon)
items.text: Coughing up blood (more than about 1 teaspoon)

items.name: low-pressure
items.description: Signs of low blood pressure (feeling cold, pale, clammy skin, light-headed, too weak to stand)
items.text: Signs of low blood pressure (feeling cold, pale, clammy skin, light-headed, too weak to stand)

items.name: ribs
items.description: Ribs are pulling in with each breath (retractions)
items.text: Ribs are pulling in with each breath (retractions)

markup.content: Urgent medical attention maybe needed. Please go to the Emergency Department.
In the two weeks before you (they) felt sick, did you (they):
Have contact with someone diagnosed with COVID-19
or
Live in or visit a place where COVID-19 is spreading
Do you (they) have any of the following? (Check any)
Do you (they) live in a long-term care facility or nursing home?
Contact a healthcare provider in the long-term care facility where you live
If you don't have a doctor or are uninsured. Visit the City of Detroit's website to find a doctor near you.
Visit City of Detroit's Website

In the last two weeks have you (they) worked or volunteered in a hospital, emergency room, clinic, medical office, long-term care facility or nursing home, ambulance service, first responder services, or any health care setting or taken care of patients as a student or part of your work?
Stay home and take care of yourself in home isolation. Call a medical provider within 24 hours.
Contact the occupational health provider at your workplace immediately
If you don't have a doctor or are uninsured. Visit the City of Detroit's website to find a doctor near you.
Visit City of Detroit's Website

Welcome to the COVID-19 Resources section.
During the assessment, you can refresh the page if you need to start again or close the chat window.
Ready? Let’s get started.
What resources are you looking for?
Welcome to the COVID-19 FAQs section.
During the assessment, you can refresh the page if you need to start again or close the chat window.
Ready? Let’s get started.
What is your question?

Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) is a respiratory illness that can spread from person to person. The virus that causes COVID-19 is a novel coronavirus that was first identified during an investigation into an outbreak in Wuhan, China.
For more information visit the City of Detroit coronavirus page.
Visit City of Detroit's Coronavirus page.

Reported illnesses have ranged from mild symptoms to severe illness and death for confirmed coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) cases. The following symptoms may appear 2-14 days after exposure. Call your doctor if you develop symptoms, and have been in close contact with a person known to have COVID-19 or have recently traveled to another country.
* Fever
* Cough
* Shortness of breath
Visit City of Detroit's Coronavirus Information page to learn more.
If you are experiencing any symptoms please contact your doctor.
If you don't have a doctor or are uninsured. Please visit the City of Detroit Coronavirus page to find a doctor near you.
Visit City of Detroit's Coronavirus Doctor page to learn more.
